info.name: API Reference
info.description:
This API Reference is designed to guide the nanopay integrator to use the **nanopay API** and act on the backend endpoints because they want to:

1. Automate functionality and filters.
2. Create new interfaces.
3. Create new functionality.
4. Edit data directly in the backend.
 
This API Reference is focused on the following most common subjects of use for the **nanopay API**:

1. User
2. Business
3. Account
4. Partner
5. Invoice

#### **Data Access Objects (DAOs)**
It is important to note a key feature, and its functions, in the technology used in the **nanopay API**. A Data Access Object (DAO) is a generic interface for a collection of objects. The DAO interface supports fetching and deleting many rows (select, removeAll), fetching and deleting single rows (find, remove) and inserts (put). The interface also includes a rich and extensible query language for filtering, sorting and aggregation.

DAOs are the primary way that records are accessed through the API. The Digital Integration Gateway (DIG) is a web endpoint that receives requests for DAO actions and supports all DAO operations.

#### **Services**
Services provide custom functionality and are a secondary way that users will interact with the API when that is not possible through DAOs. They are accessible through the Service Unified GAteway Relay (SUGAR) endpoint.  The SUGAR endpoint performs non-DAO operations against a web service.


#### **API Environments**
There are two separate external environments that exist to support the **nanopay API**: one is the live production system which provides full functionality; the other one is User Acceptance Testing (**UAT**) which does not affect live data or interact with the banking networks. Separate API keys are used to authenticate the request for each environment.

#### **API Request Formats**
The **nanopay API** supports multiple input formats for requesting data, including:
1. JSON
2. XML
3. CSV

item.name: Authentication
item.description:
Authentication is how the client proves its identity to the server.  

The **nanopay API** uses three methods for authentication:

1. Username and Password Authentication
2. API Key and Secret Authentication
3. Session ID Authentication

**HTTPS and TLS Encryption:**
* All API requests must be made over a secure TLS channel such as an HTTPS session. 
* Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. 
* API requests without authentication will also fail.

exec: // Set a random email address to create

raw: JSON.stringify({ firstName: "initialFirstName", lastName: "initialLastName", email: pm.environment.get("email"), desiredPassword: pm.environment.get("password"), organization: "initialOrganization" } )

header.description: Base64 encoding of user name and password required by basic authentication.

request.description:
## **Username and Password Authentication** 
The **nanopay API** uses Basic Authentication with username and password to authenticate requests. This is the simplest form of authentication and should not be used for advanced applications.

For a general understanding of Basic Authentication, please select this [link](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7617).

header.description: Base64 encoding of API key and secrets  required by basic authentication.

request.description:
## **API Key and Secret Authentication** 
The **nanopay API** uses Basic Authentication with API keys and secrets to authenticate requests. The API keys can be viewed and managed in the Personal Settings of the user.

For a general understanding of Basic Authentication, please select this [link](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7617).

**IMPORTANT NOTES:**

* **SECURE THE API KEYS**, as they carry the same privileges as the user that they were created for, and therefore must be secured to prevent inadvertant or malicious actions.

* **DO NOT SHARE** your secret API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code and so forth.

## **Session ID Authentication** 
Once a request has been made with a valid set of login credentials, either username/password or key/secret, a session is created and the session ID can be used to authenticate future requests in the given session. To use the session ID, retrieve it from a previously successful request and put it into the cookie of any subsequent requests.

item.name: User
item.description: The user represents a person and the user object represents that person's ability to log into and use  the system as well as act on behalf of other users or businesses, if permitted.

exec: // Set a random email address to create
// retrieve business ID here instead of later on

request.description:
## **Create a User**

Creates a user object.

**Note:** 
1. Creating a user object also creates a business object for the user. The ‘organization’ is used as the business name and all the user data is copied over to the business as well.
2. Email verification will be prompted after the object is created.

| Body Parameters | Description |
| ---- | ---- |
| **firstName** | The first name of the entity. |
| **middleName** | The middle name of the entity. |
| **lastName** | The last name of the entity. |
| **email** | The email address of the entity. |
| **desiredPassword** | The password entered by the entity. |
| **organization** | The company or business name with which the entity wishes to be associated. |

exec: console.log("Found " + data.length + " users with " + data[0].email + " email address");

query.description: The query parameter for retrieval requests.

request.description:
## **Retrieve All Users**

Queries the server to retrieve all users from within the system to which the user has access. This will be restricted to ‘user’ objects through a [query parameter](https://nanopay.postman.co/collections/5612686-728633b2-091c-4fac-8daa-837a56c94eb5?workspace=3a59dfdf-e491-4d2b-9879-375b7278914f#6fa49f76-2614-4ce0-9d14-d8e95d0a518f).

exec: console.log("Found " + data.length + " users with " + data[0].email + " email address");

query.description: The query parameter for retrieval requests.

request.description:
## **Retrieve Current User**

Queries the server to retrieve a user from the current set of users.

exec: // Change the middle name to something random
// Check to see that the middle name was updated properly

request.description:
## **Update User**

Updates a user object by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided are left unchanged. 

| Body Parameters | Description |
| -----: | ----- |
| **id** | A unique ID for the entity. |
| **enabled** | Determines whether the account is active and able to make transactions. |
| **firstName** | The first name of the entity. |
| **middleName** | The middle name of the entity. |
| **lastName** | The last name of the entity. |
| **department** | The department of the entity. |
| **email** | The email address associated with the entity.|
| **language** | The preferred language of the entity. |
| **timeZone** | The time zone of the entity. |
| **note** | A note about the entity. |
| **isPublic** | Whether the entity is publicly searchable. |
| **jobTitle** | The job title of the entity. |
| **twoFactorEnabled** | Whether two-factor authentication is enabled for this user. |

exec: // Check to see that the response contains 'success'
// Set a random email address to create
raw: JSON.stringify({ firstName: "toDeleteFirstName", lastName: "toDeleteLastName", email: emailAddress, desiredPassword: password, organization: "toDeleteOrganization" } )

query.description: The ID of the entity to be deleted in the DAO.

request.description:
## **Delete User**

Deletes a user object.

item.name: Business
item.description:
A business is an entity on behalf of which multiple users can act. A business is associated with the company name provided by the user who first creates it.

The business object allows business information to be updated and retrieved.  The body parameters refer to the business as the 'organization'.

request.description:
## **Retrieve All Businesses**

Queries the server for a list of all businesses.

query.description: The query parameter for retrieval requests.

request.description:
## **Retrieve Current Business**

Queries the server for a current business.

query.description: The business on behalf of which the user acts.

request.description:
## **Update Business** 

Updates a business object by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided are left unchanged. 

| Body Parameters | Description |
| -----: | ----- |
| **class** | Type of business. |
| **id** | A unique ID for the entity associated with a entity. |
| **enabled** | Determines whether the account is active and able to make transactions. |
| **organization** | The company or business name with which the entity wishes to be associated. |
| **email** | The email address associated with the entity.|
| **type** | The type of business. |
| **businessName** | The name of the business. |
| **website** | The website of the entity. |
| **businessTypeId** | A unique ID for the business type. |
| **businessSectorId** | A unique ID for the business sector. |
| **businessRegistrationNumber** | Business Identification Number (BIN) that identifies your business to federal, provincial or municipal governments.
 |
| **businessRegistrationAuthority** | An organization that has the power to issue and process a business registration. |
| **operatingBusinessName** | The business name displayed to the public. |
| **holdingCompany** | States if user is a holding company. Holding companies represent a corporate group which own shares of multiple companies.|
| **thirdParty** | States if the user is taking instructions from and/or acting on behalf of a 3rd party. |
| **targetCustomers** | Defines the type of clients for the organization. |
| **sourceOfFunds** | Where the organization receives its funds. |
| **taxIdentificationNumber** | The authorized tax identification number of the entity. |

query.description: The ID of the entity to be deleted in the DAO.

request.description:
## **Delete Business**

Deletes a business (organization) object.

item.name: Account

request.description:
## **Create User Account**

Creates a Canadian bank account object.


| Body Parameters | Description |
| -----: | ----- |
| **class** | Type of bank account. |
| **branch** | The branch transit number of the bank account. |
| **branchId** | The branch transit number of the bank account. |
| **institutionNumber** | The institution number of the created bank account. |
| **country** | The country code of the bank account. |
| **accountNumber** | The account number of the bank account. |
| **status** | The status of the bank account. |
| **denomination** | The type of currency associated with the bank account. |
| **verificationAttempts** | The number of times it is attempted to verify ownership of the bank account. |
| **microVerificationTimestamp** | The timestamp of when ownership of the bank account is verified. |
| **address** | A section allocated to fields related to the address of the bank branch. |
| _verified_ | Determines if the address is verified. |
| _countryId_ | The ID of the country. |
| _regionId_ | The ID of the region, province or state. |
| _streetNumber_ | The street number of the entity's address. |
| _streetName_ | The street name of the entity's address. |
| _suite_ | The suite number of the entity's address. |
| _city_ | The city of the entity's address. 
| _postalCode_ | The postal code of the entity's address. |
| **bankAddress** | A section allocated to the fields related to the bank. |
| _verified_ | Determines if the address is verified. |
| _countryId_ | The ID of the country. |
| _regionId_ | The ID of the region, province or state. |
| _streetNumber_ | The street number of the entity's address. |
| _streetName_ | The street name of the entity's address. |
| _suite_ | The suite number of the entity's address. |
| _city_ | The city of the entity's address. |
| _postalCode_ | The postal code of the entity's address. |
| **enabled** | Determines whether the account is active and able to make transactions. |
| **name** | The name of the account. |
| **desc** | The description of the account. |
| **transferIn** | Determines if an account can receive transfers. |
| **transferOut** | Determines if an account can make transfers out. |
| **isDefault** | Determines the default account of the entity. |
| **institution** | The institution number of the created bank account.|
| **owner** | The ID of the entity who owns the account. |

## **Create Business Account**

| Body Parameters | Description |

| **verificationAttempts** | The number of times it is attempted to verify ownership of the bank account. |
| **microVerificationTimestamp** | The timestamp of when ownership of the bank account is verified. |
| **address** | A section allocated to fields related to the address of the bank branch. |
| _verified_ | Determines if the address is verified. |
| _countryId_ | The ID of the country. |
| _regionId_ | The ID of the region, province or state. |

| _postalCode_ | The postal code of the entity's address. |

| **owner** | The ID of the entity who owns the account. |

| **owner** | The ID of the entity who owns the account. |
| **institution** | The institution number of the created bank account.|

item.name: Partner
item.description: A partner is a linking relationship between two users that exist in the system.

request.description:
**Create Partner Connection**

Creates a partner object.

| Body Parameters | Description |
| -----: | ----- |
| **sourceId** | The ID of the source. |
| **targetId** | The ID of the target. |
| **partnerId** | The ID of the partner. |
| **yourId** | The ID of the entity. |

## **Retrieve Partner Connections**

Queries the server for a list of existing partner connections.

request.description:

Queries the server for a list of public users in the system that can become partners.

item.name: Invoice
item.description: An invoice object can be used to create and manage an invoice against which payment can be made.

query.description: The business on behalf of which the user acts.

request.description:
## **Creates an invoice**

Creates an invoice object.

| Body Parameters | Description |
| -----: | ----- |
| **class** | Type of invoice. |
| **name** | The name of the invoice. |
| **sourceAccount** | The bank account of the payer. |
| **destinationAccount** | The bank account of the payee | **amount** | The amound of the invoice to be paid. |
| **payerID** | The ID associated with the payer. |
| **payeeID** | The ID associated with the payee. |
| **destinationCurrency** | The type of currency required by the invoice. |

query.description: The business on behalf of which the user acts.

request.description:
## **Query Invoice**

Queries all invoices associated with the requesting entity.

item.name: Help
item.description: Use this Help for additional information beyond the core functions outlined in this API Reference.

item.name: Query Parameter
item.description:
This is a query syntax that allows for filtering of entities within a DAO where access is based on the fields in the entity. 

**About the query syntac**

* ‘q’ is the query parameter for retrieval requests (i.e. cmd=select).
* is composed of HTML encoded strings
* is composed of predicates (e.g. x =< y) linked by logical operators (e.g. and, or)
* used to filter on retrieval (i.e. q=”xxx”)
* used to get a specific entity or all entities with specific values
